page.title: 01Haltwhistle town
page.content: Haltwhistle is a small market town situated on the north side of the river South Tyne. Around it are hill farms rearing sheep and cattle. A few miles to the north is the Roman Wall which attracts many visitors to the town. The centre of the town is its market square where a market has been held every Thursday since 1207. Its busy main street has food shops where all basic commodities can be bought including fresh meat, fruit, vegetables and bread. It houses a library, dentist, blacksmith, travel agency, and a small hospital. For the people in the surrounding area it can supply all their needs, though most travel to Carlisle, Hexham or Newcastle to buy clothes or furniture.
